place.name: LLANFABON
place.gazetteerText: LLANFABON, a parish in Merthyr-Tydvil district, Glamorgan; on the rivers Taff and Rumney, near the Taff Vale railway, the Merthvr-Tydvil canal, and the bound ary with Monmouth 5½ miles NNW of Caerphilly. It contains the hamlets of Garth and Glynrumney; and its Post town is Pontypridd. Acres, 5,369. Real property, £11,915; of which £30 are in quarries, and £8,184 in the canal. Pop. in 1851,1,925; in 1861,2,360. Houses, 439. The surface is hilly. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Llandaff.Value, £120. Patrons, the Dean and Chapter of Llandaff. The church is dedicated to St. Mabon; was rebuilt in 1863; is in the early geometric pointed style; and consists of nave, chancel, and vestry. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
